etymology.description: 帮(幫) (bāng, "help; assist") and 助(助) (zhù, "aid; assist") together emphasize the action of providing assistance or support.
etymology.interpretation: 帮(幫) (bāng, "help; assist") and 助(助) (zhù, "aid; assist") both imply offering support or help to someone else. Their combination strengthens the notion of providing assistance or aiding others.

examples.chinese: 我常常帮助有需要的人(我常常幫助有需要的人)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ chángcháng bāngzhù yǒu xūqiú de rén.
examples.english: I often help those in need.

examples.chinese: 他帮助邻居(他幫助鄰居)，也给予了鼓励(也給予了鼓勵)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bāngzhù línjū, yě jǐyǔle gǔlì.
examples.english: He helps his neighbors and also gives them encouragement.
